text: The Ukrainian diplomatic mission in Poland is represented by the Embassy of Ukraine in Warsaw. On December 2, 1991, Poland recognized Ukraine's independence. The establishment of diplomatic relations took place on January 4, 1992. When Ukraine gained its independence in 1991, it established diplomatic ties with Poland by sending a diplomat with the title of "Special Envoy of the government" and opening an office there. It was promoted to diplomatic status in 1992. Its current address is 7 Szucha, 00-580 Warsaw, the former USSR Trade Representation building. title: Embassy of Ukraine in Warsaw
